intro: Oldenlandia capituliflora, commonly known as the velvetleaf or false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a velvety texture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Oldenlandia capituliflora is often found in disturbed soils and can be invasive in some areas.
